intro: Geissanthus sodiroanus, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool and moist environments. It has elliptical leaves with a leathery texture and produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer seasons. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
